page.title: 01THE HOLMS, COPINSAY,
page.content: The Holms are Ward Holm, Black Holm and the larger Corn Holm. The rocks of Ward Holm and Corn Holm are mainly middle old red sanstone flags laid down in shallow fresh water and are some 350-400 million years old. Black Holm differs in that it has a sill of igneous greenstone. Bands of white and rosy quartzite can be found at the S.E. corner. The Holms are covered in rough grass. The Holms are connected to each other and the nature reserve of Copinsay at low tide and are considered part of the reserve. There are many types of sea birds including Puffins and a colony of Artic Terns on Corn Holm. The Holms are populated by colonies of Grey Seals. Corn Holm has one of the best colonies of oyster plant in Orkney on its beach.
